author: Paston, George
snippet: ' I was out of bed this morning before half-past six o'^clock, and went to enjoy les reveries d\me jyromenade solitaire in the park. I walked from Spring Gardens thro' the Queen's and Hyde Park as far as Kensington, and returned to breakfast at a quarter after eight. It was one of the most delicious mornings I ever beheld, and calculated to excite all the benevolence of a heart that rejoices in the display of natural beauty.
